events.originalText: Barges being towed destroyed part of a bridge near Webbers Falls, Oklahoma, causing vehicles to fall into the Robert S. Kerr Reservoir on the Arkansas River.
events.subtitle: I-40 bridge disaster
events.headline: Barges Destroy Part of Bridge Near Webbers Falls, Oklahoma

events.originalText: Manchester United won the UEFA Champions League to become the first English football club to win three major championships in the same season.
events.subtitle: Manchester United F.C.
events.headline: Manchester United Wins UEFA Champions League

events.originalText: Tropical Storm Cecil dissipated over Laos after devastating Quảng Nam province, Vietnam, and causing the deaths of 751 people.
events.subtitle: Tropical Storm Cecil
events.headline: Tropical Storm Cecil Devastates Quảng Nam Province, Vietnam

events.originalText: The Beatles'  Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band, one of the first progressive rock albums, was released.
events.subtitle: The Beatles
events.headline: The Beatles Release Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band

events.originalText: Second World War: The Allies began a mass evacuation of British, French and Belgian troops cut off by the German army during the Battle of Dunkirk.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allies Begin Mass Evacuation at Dunkirk

events.originalText: The House Un-American Activities Committee was established to investigate alleged disloyalty and subversive activities by people or organizations in the U.S. suspected of having communist or fascist ties.
events.subtitle: House Un-American Activities Committee
events.headline: House Un-American Activities Committee Established

events.originalText: American singer Jimmie Rodgers (pictured) died at the Taft Hotel in New York City.
events.subtitle: Jimmie Rodgers
events.headline: American Singer Jimmie Rodgers Dies in New York City

events.originalText: American singer Jimmie Rodgers (pictured) died at the Taft Hotel in New York City.
events.subtitle: Jimmie Rodgers
events.headline: Donoghue v Stevenson Establishes Negligence Law

events.originalText: Donoghue v Stevenson is decided, ultimately establishing the foundation for negligence in common law jurisdictions worldwide.
events.subtitle: Donoghue v Stevenson
events.headline: Vauxhall Bridge in London Opens

events.originalText: Vauxhall Bridge in London opened, crossing the River Thames between Vauxhall and Westminster.
events.subtitle: Vauxhall Bridge
events.headline: Church of England Returns William Bradford's Manuscript

events.originalText: The Church of England returned the original manuscript of William Bradford's Of Plymouth Plantation, an account of the Pilgrims and the early years of the Plymouth Colony, to the state of Massachusetts.
events.subtitle: Church of England
events.headline: Emmanuel Lasker Defeats Wilhelm Steinitz in Chess

events.originalText: Germany's Emmanuel Lasker defeated Wilhelm Steinitz to become world chess champion, beginning a record 27-year reign.
events.subtitle: Emanuel Lasker
events.headline: The Diary of a Nobody Appears in Punch

events.originalText: The comic novel The Diary of a Nobody by brothers George and Weedon Grossmith first appeared in serial form in Punch.
events.subtitle: The Diary of a Nobody
events.headline: General Edmund Kirby Smith Negotiates Surrender

events.originalText: American Civil War: General Edmund Kirby Smith negotiated the surrender of his army, the only significant Confederate Army force remaining in the war.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Deadliest Fire in Norwegian History at Church in Grue

events.originalText: The deadliest fire in Norwegian history  occurred at a church in Grue, killing at least 113 people.
events.subtitle: Grue Church fire
events.headline: Portuguese Restoration War Battle of Montijo Ends in Victory

events.originalText: Portuguese Restoration War: Portuguese and Spanish forces both claimed victory at the Battle of Montijo.
events.subtitle: Portuguese Restoration War
events.headline: William of Ockham Leaves Avignon Secretly

events.originalText: English friar William of Ockham, who popularised the methodological principle known as Occam's razor, secretly left Avignon under threat from Pope John XXII.
events.subtitle: Friar
events.headline: King Edmund I of England Murdered at Pucklechurch

events.originalText: King Edmund I of England was murdered at Pucklechurch on the feast day of St Augustine.
events.subtitle: Edmund I
